verses.verse: (Prayer for Deliverance from Persecutors) A Prayer of David. Hear a just cause, O LORD; attend to my cry; give ear to my prayer from lips free of deceit.
From you let my vindication come; let your eyes see the right.
(Job 23.10; Ps 26.2; 39.1; 66.10; Jer 50.20) If you try my heart, if you visit me by night, if you test me, you will find no wickedness in me; my mouth does not transgress.
(Prov 1.15) As for what others do, by the word of your lips I have avoided the ways of the violent.
(Ps 18.36; 44.18) My steps have held fast to your paths; my feet have not slipped.
(Ps 86.7; 88.2) I call upon you, for you will answer me, O God; incline your ear to me; hear my words.
(Ps 20.6; 31.21) Wondrously show your steadfast love, O savior of those who seek refuge from their adversaries at your right hand.
(Deut 32.10; Ps 36.7) Guard me as the apple of the eye; hide me in the shadow of your wings,
from the wicked who despoil me, my deadly enemies who surround me.
(1 Sam 2.3; Ps 31.18; 73.7) They close their hearts to pity; with their mouths they speak arrogantly.
They flush me out; (Q ms Gk: MT Our steps) now they surround me; they set their eyes to cast me to the ground.
(Ps 7.2; 10.9) They are like a lion eager to tear, like a young lion lurking in ambush.
(Ps 7.12; 22.20; 73.18) Rise up, O LORD, confront them, overthrow them! By your sword deliver my life from the wicked,

(Job 21.11; Ps 73.3-7; Isa 2.7; Lk 16.8) from mortals—by your hand, O LORD— from mortals whose portion in life is in this world. May their bellies be filled with what you have stored up for them; may their children have more than enough; may they leave something over to their little ones.
(Ps 4.6, 7; 16.11; 1 Jn 3.2) As for me, I shall behold your face in righteousness; when I awake I shall be satisfied, beholding your likeness.
